intelligence uh back in 2008 2009 U I also spent some time in Industry proper
I was managing the AI research lab at Bloomberg for some time in New York uh
which allowed also to explore some aspects of uh attempting to use a

this set of workshops and the realization that the types of technology that we're developing today can have an

should we really be attacking first which ones are most important where can
AI have an impact and the fortuitous answer that we came to was that the
United Nations had already done this work for us and the United Nations built the sustainable development goals which
is a set of 17 goals 16 that are thematic and one that involves building
infrastructure that is strategic across the entire set and they cover problems like removing poverty and ensuring that

with these challenges directly as well as a whole set of nonprofits that

that already wants their input and already has data that they can use um

the first big program that we ran with a network of universities and and companies um and nonprofits and the
government was around food security and we call this the food security AI
Challenge and what we did in the first instance was go to many different
companies that were operating in this section whether it's the actual agricultural and output side so farmers

who actually go out to the Farms purchase the goods move them from one
Warehouse to another eventually move them into refining and and other plants

size so the the consumption side of that equation and we gathered data set and we
tried to bring people on board with a view to contributing the information that they had about their part of that
puzzle now we then made those data sets available so climate data phenotypic genotypic data about seed varieties
growing data kind of supply chain data so where food was being consumed when
and and so on to a community of people who signed up and those people came from
industry so we had entrance from all over the world but especially from US Canada uh Europe China Australia
and and South America and what we were looking for was for people to apply on
this data interesting metrics to help us first understand the whole landscape we

relationship with uh the ACM conference on knowledge Discovery and data mining which is one of the largest machine
